page.title: 05WEATHER REPORT - RISBOROUGH
page.content: The first six months of 1985 gave us our usual mixture of weather. We have h d the wettest summer equinox for 25 years, 11 consecutive saturdays with unpleasant weather, a blizzard in the middle of January, snow at first day of spring and a heavy hail storm in early june. However there have been better days.A warm may day bank holiday, a day with cloudless skies and 13 hours of sunshine in April, and several days with beautiful sunsets coloured by dust from the Sahara. The whole of the week after the late spring bank holiday was wm, dry and sunny, bringing us to flaming June; it did'nt last long, by the 7th the maximum temperature fell to 9c and by the end of the month it was to become one of the wettest junes on record. Where would we be without our englist weather!.
